static LcsProvider * GetInstance ()
 The only method to get the instance of this class.

Detailed Description

This is the interface class to all the Lcs Applications. It forwards the invokation to the appropriate provider implementation

Member Function Documentation

LcsErrorCode LcsProvider::AbortSelfLocReq (   ) 
 

This method aborts the ongoing self-location request.

LcsProvider * LcsProvider::GetInstance (   )  [static]
 

The only method to get the instance of this class.

LastLocationEstimate LcsProvider::GetLastKnownLocation (   )  const
 

This method returns the location information obtained from the last self-location request.

LcsErrorCode LcsProvider::RegisterForMtlr (  const Application *  app  ) 
 

This method registers the only application that should receive MT-LR notifications & send response to MT-LR verification

LcsErrorCode LcsProvider::SelfLocationReq (  LcsCost  lcs_cost = Low,
const LcsMmiQos &  lcs_mmi_qos = LcsMmiQos(),
INT32  repeat_interval = -1
) 
 

This method performs a self-location request based on the cost criteria. Repetition is possible by specifying a non-negative repeat interval.

LcsErrorCode LcsProvider::SendVerificationResult (  UINT16  invoke_id,
BOOLEAN  user_response
) 
 

This method sends the user's verification response to the network.

BOOLEAN LcsProvider::SetNmeaUartSettings (  BOOLEAN  nmea_switch,
const NmeaUartSettings &  nmea_uart_settings
) 
 

This method is used to indicate whether NMEA output to the serial interface should be switched on/off. In the ON case, the new UART settings to be used can also be set.

BOOLEAN LcsProvider::SetProtocol (  LcsTransportType  new_protocol  ) 
 

This method is invoked when another protocol is set active via the Lcs settings menu. This method should be invoked only by the Lcs settings application.

LcsErrorCode LcsProvider::TransferLocationReq (  const LcsMmiQos &  lcs_mmi_qos,
const ClientId &  client_id,
const MlcNumber &  mlc_number,
INT32  repeat_interval = -1
) 
 

This method transfers the location information of the MS to an external LCS client via a particular GMLC, if possible.
